intro: Darwinia exaltata, commonly known as the tall spike heath, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and dense clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it blooms during the spring and summer months. Darwinia exaltata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
